description:
bzr942 RHEL6

X-Server-Management-Url is populated from request header.
Compare responses for curl and jclouds.
Expected: X-Server-Management-Url is set from stabile source

JClouds

- Http: Request, GET /v1.1 
  + URI: /v1.1
    Host:  dragon004.hw.griddynamics.net
    UserAgent:  jclouds/1.0 java/1.6.0_18

- Http: Response, HTTP/1.1, Status: No content, URL: /v1.1 
    StatusCode: 204, No content
    X-Server-Management-Url:  http://dragon004/v1.1
    X-Storage-Url:  
    X-Cdn-Management-Url:  

Curl	
	
- Request	
 User-Agent: curl/7.21.1 (i686-pc-mingw32) libcurl/7.21.1 OpenSSL/0.9.8k zlib/1.2.3
 Host: dragon004:8774
 
- Response
 X-Server-Management-Url: http://dragon004:8774/v1.1/
 X-Storage-Url:
 X-Cdn-Management-Url:
title: X-Server-Management-Url is filled from http header

comments.content:
bzr942 RHEL6

X-Server-Management-Url is populated from request header.
Compare responses for curl and jclouds.
Expected: X-Server-Management-Url is set from stabile source

JClouds

- Http: Request, GET /v1.1 
  + URI: /v1.1
    Host:  dragon004.hw.griddynamics.net
    UserAgent:  jclouds/1.0 java/1.6.0_18

- Http: Response, HTTP/1.1, Status: No content, URL: /v1.1 
    StatusCode: 204, No content
    X-Server-Management-Url:  http://dragon004/v1.1
    X-Storage-Url:  
    X-Cdn-Management-Url:  

Curl	
	
- Request	
 User-Agent: curl/7.21.1 (i686-pc-mingw32) libcurl/7.21.1 OpenSSL/0.9.8k zlib/1.2.3
 Host: dragon004:8774
 
- Response
 X-Server-Management-Url: http://dragon004:8774/v1.1/
 X-Storage-Url:
 X-Cdn-Management-Url:
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vgalkin

comments.content:
Looks like duplicate of https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/741972
Other use case.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~vgalkin

comments.content: Keeping it as a separate bug to make sure the two cases are fixed.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
This looks like it's just a bug in jclouds. It should include the port number in the Host header of its request

http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc2616/rfc2616-sec14.html#sec14.23

  "A "host" without any trailing port information implies the default port for the service requested (e.g., "80" for an HTTP URL)"
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc
